item.description:
"She was looking for that bakery. Every time she shifted the angle of her body, the shotgun shells in her pocket rustled like buckwheat husks in an old-fashioned pillow."

With the same deadpan mania and genius for dislocation that he brought to his internationally acclaimed novels, Haruki Murakami makes this collection of stories a determined assault on the normal. A man sees his favorite elephant vanish into thin air; a newlywed couple suffers attacks of hunger that drive them to hold up a McDonald's in the middle of the night; and a young woman discovers that she has become irresistible to a little green monster who burrows up through her backyard.

By turns haunting and hilarious, The Elephant Vanishes is further proof of Murakami's ability to cross the border between separate realities -- and to come back bearing treasure.

Please read and join our discussion of the following stories:

The Wind-up Bird and Tuesday's Women
The Second Bakery Attack
The Kangaroo Communique
Sleep
The Elephant Vanishes

group.name: Classic Books: Book Club for Die-hard Readers

item.name: Murakami: The Elephant Vanishes
